speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz... how are you?

speaker: Roz
text: Still pregnant.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I-I'm sorry about last night.  I tried to apologize, but you ran out of the party so fast.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I'm sorry!  Was that rude?  You know more about etiquette that I do.  What is the proper length of time you should stay after someone announces to a hundred strangers that you got knocked up?

speaker: Frasier
text: I tried to call.

speaker: Roz
text: I know, I wasn't answering.  I was up all night thinking about what I want to do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose a decision of that magnitude would take many sleepless--

speaker: Roz
text: I'm having the baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: -hours to make.  Are you sure, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: I know it seems quick.  But even when I was hoping I wasn't pregnant, I knew if I was, I was keeping the baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then let me be the first to congratulate you!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thanks.  [_They hug._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, oh God, that's so wonderful!  You're gonna make a great mom!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I did the first part pretty well, and I wasn't even trying.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, have you told the father?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, I called him at nine o'clock this morning, which was seven o'clock at night, Cairo time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that a pertinent fact, or are you just trying to impress me with your mastery of time zones?

speaker: Roz
text: I mean he moved to Cairo, working on a project.  He's an architect.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, when's he coming back?

speaker: Roz
text: He isn't. [_off his surprised look_] But that's perfectly fine with me.  I'm perfectly comfortable raising this baby by myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: And... I'm sure everyone around here will give you plenty of support.  [_Bulldog comes in to grab some carts._]

speaker: Bulldog
text: So, Roz, who's the proud papa?  You got it narrowed down yet? [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: That's nice, very nice.  Frasier, will you excuse us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Just remember the baby's future, Roz.  Try to make it look like an accident.  [_Frasier leaves._]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Look, I was just kidding.  I'm sure you probably know who the dad is.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that's what I wanted to talk to you about.  Do you remember Janet's party a couple months ago?  You got really drunk and I drove you home?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah... what about it?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you invited me up, and I guess I'd had a few myself, because the next thing I knew--

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, whoa -- I don't believe this.  I don't even remember us--

speaker: Roz
text: Now calm down, Bulldog--

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, come on, please, just tell me you're joking.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, we don't have to get married right away--

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, man!  Oh, man!  [_He paces, chewing his knuckles.  She caresses his back._]

speaker: Roz
text: I thought you'd be happy about this.  I mean, we were wonderful together.  When you made love to me, you were so tender and caring--

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, whoa!  Ha, ha!  "Tender and caring?"  No way was that me!  Yeah, you almost had me!  Good one, Roz.  [_He leaves the booth.  She smiles as yet another round of their never- ending gamesmanship goes to her._]  [_Scene Two -- Apartment Martin is reading the paper in his Armchair.  The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Martin
text: Someone at the door!  [_Daphne comes out of the kitchen laden with plates and silverware._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Really?  So that's what that funny chiming sound means.  I'm a little indisposed here, would you mind?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh sure, sorry, Daph. [_calls_] Hang on, she's coming!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_putting the plates down_] You take it easy, rest up for that big trek to the dinner table.  [_She goes to the door and opens it to Niles._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, before I even come in, I just have to say I am mortified by my behavior last night.  Honestly, I don't know what got into me.

speaker: Martin
text: About a quart of vodka, for starters.

speaker: Daphne
text: There's no need for an apology.  I thought what you did was very chivalrous.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I happen to believe that if a woman finds herself in such a predicament, a man of honor has an obligation to step forward and do the right thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Now poor Roz really is in that predicament.

speaker: Niles
text: Do I smell chicken?  [_Frasier comes out of the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles.  We'll be serving dinner just as soon as Roz gets here.  I didn't think she should be alone this evening.

speaker: Daphne
text: How's she doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, O.K., I guess, considering she's decided to have the baby by herself.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, things have really changed since my day.  Back then, if a girl got in trouble, her family would send her away to relatives in another state, and if anybody asked, just lied and said she went to Europe.  Then when she came back, they'd raise the baby as a little sister.  Not like today -- we had morals and values back then.

speaker: Niles
text: I always assumed I'd have children, but if Maris and I don't reconcile soon, the issue will be moot.  She's a tad older than I am, and her biological clock is winding down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Luckily, she flies to Zurich twice a year to have it reset.

speaker: Daphne
text: Babies are wonderful, but Roz does have a tough road ahead of her.

speaker: Niles
text: It can never be easy balancing a career with motherhood.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the big question is where's she going to find a husband?  I mean, a little kid needs a mother and a father.  [_Doorbell._]

speaker: Frasier
text: That's Roz!  Just remember, she came here tonight to have a quiet little evening, not to be reminded of the difficult situation she's in. We'll just take our cue from her.  If she doesn't bring it up, we won't discuss it!  Agreed?  [_Everyone agrees._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you may answer the door.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, thank you! [_goes to the door_] Why don't I just get a feather duster and a French maid's uniform?

speaker: Niles
text: That would teach them, wouldn't it, Daphne, and I would pick it out for you!  [_Frasier gives him yet another "knock it off" bat on the arm.  Daphne opens the door to Roz._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi.  [_Everyone greets Roz warmly._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dinner's almost ready, make yourself comfortable.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks.  [_She hangs up her coat and purse, and sits on the couch.  Silence._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So... that's such a cute skirt.

speaker: Roz
text: I just got it.  [_Silence._]

speaker: Martin
text: I just got these pants.

speaker: Roz
text: They're nice.  [_Silence._]

speaker: Roz
text: I got some interesting news!  Well, last night, I -- and a large portion of Seattle -- found out I was pregnant!  Don't you guys want to ask me about it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sure, we all do!  But we were told not to.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Frasier's afraid we might say something to make you uncomfortable.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's silly.  I want to talk about it.  I'm really excited, I'm going to be a mom!  I've got a lot to do.  I'll tell you one thing I'm gonna need, pronto--

speaker: Martin
text: A husband!

speaker: Roz
text: I was going to say a bigger apartment.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Well, maybe the husband'll have one.  [_Frasier comes out with some appetizers._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So, how did the father take it? [_off Frasier's glare_] Don't worry, she brought it up!

speaker: Roz
text: He actually took it really well.  He's not going to be that involved, though.  He moved to Cairo.

speaker: Niles
text: Where would he have moved to if he'd taken it badly?

speaker: Roz
text: No, he's working in Cairo on a project, he's an archaeologist.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, can I get you a drink?

speaker: Roz
text: O.K., do you have any mineral water?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I have eight different kinds.  Why don't you come into the kitchen and pick one?  [_Roz gets up and follows Frasier into the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's got room for eight different kinds of water in that fridge, and I have to keep my can of spray cheese under the sink.  [_In the kitchen, Roz pours herself some mineral water._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this morning you told me the father was an architect.

speaker: Roz
text: I did?  Oh, that was a slip of the tongue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  And, uh, how did you two meet again?

speaker: Roz
text: In a bar.

speaker: Frasier
text: This morning you told me it was on a double-date.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's right, it was!  It was on a double-date.

speaker: Frasier
text: This morning you told me nothing! [_Roz flinches_] What is going on, Roz, you're obviously hiding something. [_Niles comes in_] Niles, please, would you excuse us?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, by all means.  I just came in to open a bottle of wine. [_takes one down_] Sorry. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, what's going on?  Is it that you don't know who the father is?

speaker: Roz
text: Of course I know!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then why don't you tell me?

speaker: Roz
text: I haven't even told him yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh?

speaker: Roz
text: And I'm not sure I'm going to tell him.  It's a little complicated--

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, Roz, I don't care who the father is.  The man has a right to know that he's going to have a child.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, this really isn't any of your business.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, it's certainly _his_ business.  You have an obligation to let this man know that you're having his baby! [_Niles comes in again_] Niles, do you mind?  It's impossible to have a conversation here with you constantly eavesdropping.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know what you two are talking about, but I resent the implication that I have nothing better to do than to spy on you like a nosy teenager.  I came in for a corkscrew. [_gets it and walks out_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, I-I'm sorry--  [_In the living room:_]

speaker: Niles
text: All I could get was that she hasn't told the father yet.  [_Martin shakes his fists with frustration, Daphne just licks her lips at the scoop._]  [_Scene Three -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier gives his order to Rick, the young counter waiter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Double latte, please.

speaker: Rick
text: Coming right up.  I'll bring it to your table.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_Frasier goes to his table.  Roz comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier?  What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I realize it must be a shock to see me here in this place I come to every day of my life.

speaker: Roz
text: You had a dental appointment!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I rescheduled it for tomorrow.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks for telling me!

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on?

speaker: Roz
text: All right, [_lowers voice_] I came here to talk to him -- the father, yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, I'm proud of you!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, thank you very much, now get out of here!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, just wait one second. [_Rick brings his coffee_] Excuse me, may I have that to go, please?

speaker: Rick
text: Oh sure, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Rick
text: Hey, Roz!  How you doing?

speaker: Roz
text: Fine, thanks.

speaker: Rick
text: Well, what can I get you?

speaker: Roz
text: Uh, I'll have a decaf.

speaker: Rick
text: Be right back.  [_Rick goes to the counter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: He's a nice kid, Rick.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, he is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Working here to put himself through school, right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, he is.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's the father, isn't he?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, he is.  [_And with that, Frasier leaving is out of the question._]  [_END OF ACT ONE_]  [_ACT TWO_]  **LET'S SEE ALEC GUINESS BLOW UP ONE OF THOSE**  [_Scene Four -- Cafe Frasier and Roz sit back down at his table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: The father of your child is a teenager!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, of course he is not a teenager anymore!  He had a birthday three weeks ago!  Look, uh, you know, we just went out for a couple of weeks, and then it was over, there were no hard feelings.  It is a little embarrassing, though, him being seven years younger than I am-- [_off Frasier's look_] oh, put your eyebrows down!  I've seen your driver's license, and you don't weigh no "One-Seventy!"  Now you know what I'm talking about.  I don't want to ruin his whole life.

speaker: Frasier
text: He still has a right to know.

speaker: Roz
text: I know that.  But it's not gonna be easy.  When you were a junior in college, if a woman came to you and told you she was carrying your child, wouldn't you have been devastated?

speaker: Frasier
text: In my case, I would have been mystified.

speaker: Roz
text: How do I even begin to tell him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, something like that is never easy.  [_Rick brings their coffees._]

speaker: Rick
text: So, Roz, what made you switch to decaf?

speaker: Frasier
text: Then again, sometimes a natural opening does present itself.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm just trying to stay healthy.  Listen, Rick, I've been trying to call you, but your number wasn't working.

speaker: Rick
text: Oh yeah, I'm not in the dorms anymore.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you got your own place?

speaker: Rick
text: No, I moved back in with my parents.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, isn't that your dad over there waving to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course.  My dad is over there waving to me. [_turns and sees Martin in the doorway_] Oh look -- my dad's over there waving to me!  [_Martin sits at a corner table.  Frasier goes over.  Rick sits down with Roz._]

speaker: Rick
text: So, you look incredible.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks.  [_At the other table:_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what are you doing here?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Sherry took her sister to that store across the street to buy some foundation garments.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think they call them "bras" now.

speaker: Martin
text: Not these, you don't.  You could cross the River Kwai on one of those babies.  [_At the first table:_]

speaker: Roz
text: So, I have some news for you--

speaker: Rick
text: Oh, I've got some news too!  You remember I was telling you about that Junior Year Abroad Program?  I'm in!  I leave next fall and I will be spending the rest of the year in Paris!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I'm so happy for you!

speaker: Rick
text: Yeah, I'm thinking, first my soccer team wins the championship, then I ace my finals, now I'm going to Paris!  I'm wondering, "What next!"

speaker: Roz
text: Funny you should ask...  [_Frasier is trying to watch Roz, but Martin is trying to get his attention._]

speaker: Martin
text: I'm telling you, there's something in my eye!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't see anything.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't see anything!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're not even looking!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reaches his hand out_] Well then, here, let me--

speaker: Martin
text: No, don't touch!  Don't touch!  [_Frasier turns to see Rick get up and storm out of the caf e._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Dad, I've got to go talk to Roz, just go into the bathroom and wash it out with cold water.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, I'm sure glad I worked all those extra shifts to put you through medical school, it really paid off!  [_Martin goes to the bathroom.  Frasier walks over._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: Don't worry, I told him.

speaker: Frasier
text: How'd he take it?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, he was pretty freaked out, actually.  But I assured him that I didn't need anything from him, and I was going to raise the baby by myself.  Anyway, he's gonna be fine. [_checks her watch_] Oh my God, I'm late for a doctor's appointment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you gonna be all right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I take you to dinner tonight?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thank you, Frasier, that would be nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: O.K.  [_He kisses her cheek, and she leaves.  Martin comes back._]

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, I can't stand these yuppie joints.  Some bozo went through the men's room, correcting all the grammar in the graffiti with a red pen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I noticed.

speaker: Martin
text: I mean, who'd have that much time on his hands?

speaker: Frasier
text: Unbelievable.

speaker: Martin
text: It was Niles, wasn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll talk to him again.  [_Scene Five -- Roz's Apartment Roz is sitting on her bed looking at a sonogram picture.  Someone knocks._]

speaker: Roz
text: It's open, Frasier.  [_Rick comes in with a bouquet of roses._]

speaker: Rick
text: Hi.  I'm sorry, I probably should have called first--

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's all right!  I'm just kind of surprised to see you here.

speaker: Rick
text: I'm kind of surprised to be here.  Oh, these are for you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_takes the flowers_] Thank you.

speaker: Rick
text: There was a card, too, but it kind of blew off on the way over here.  I rode my bike.  [_Roz absorbs yet another reminder of how young he is._]

speaker: Rick
text: I acted like an idiot today.

speaker: Roz
text: It's O.K.--

speaker: Rick
text: No, it's not!  I mean, when you told me, all I could think about was myslef and how it was going to affect me.  Then I started thinking about you, and the, uh...

speaker: Roz
text: The baby.

speaker: Rick
text: Right.  That's the other reason I'm here.  I'm not going to Paris.  I'm not going anywhere.  I'm quitting school, and I'm going to work at the Cafe full time!

speaker: Roz
text: So you've come to tell me you've lost your mind.

speaker: Rick
text: No.  I came here to ask you to marry me.  [_Roz is overwhelmed for a moment._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Rick... that's so... wrong.

speaker: Rick
text: Oh yeah, that's right! [_kneels down_] Roz, will you marry me?

speaker: Roz
text: No, no!  The proposal was fine, it was lovely.

speaker: Rick
text: Listen, I have been thinking about this all afternoon.  I could fall in love with you.  I could be a good husband, and a good father.

speaker: Roz
text: Rick, that's the whole point of being twenty.  You could be anything.  I'm much older than you, I am things.

speaker: Rick
text: I'm not too young for this!  You know, my mom was only seventeen when she had me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_worst one so far_] Your mother's only thirty-seven?

speaker: Rick
text: Yeah.  And, boy, would you two hit if off!  I mean, you have a lot in common.  In fact, you sort of even look like--

speaker: Roz
text: Stop right there!  Listen, your proposal was so sweet.  It's my first, actually.

speaker: Rick
text: Yeah, mine too.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh... I hope that you can understand why I can't possibly marry you.  When I get married, it's going to be to someone I love, and to someone who loves me, and someone who can legally drink champagne at my wedding!  [_Rick realizes that's her final answer._]

speaker: Rick
text: O.K.  I understand. [_notices picture_] So, is this--?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, it's the sonogram picture.  It came this morning. [_shows him_] Right there.

speaker: Rick
text: Wow... that dot's my kid.

speaker: Roz
text: No, that dot's just a dot.  That dot's your kid.  You can have it.  And I could send you photos, updates, that sort of thing?

speaker: Rick
text: I would like that.  Thank you.  Roz, are you sure--?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I am.  I think this is the right thing, for you and for me.  Now go.  Go to Paris!  Go learn, go have fun!  Just don't come back wearing a beret!  [_They go to the door.  He hugs her._]

speaker: Rick
text: O.K.  Take care of yourself.

speaker: Roz
text: You too.  [_She brushes his shoulder as he leaves.  She closes the door goes to the kitchen to put the flowers away.  Someone knocks._]

speaker: Roz
text: I said go!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s._] But I just got here!  [_Roz runs back and opens the door._]

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry, Frasier, come in!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming in_] I ran into Rick in the hall.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  He asked me to marry him.  I said no.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was very sweet of him.  [_From the kitchen, a kettle whistles._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I was just making some tea, do you want some?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, sure, thanks.  With milk, please. [_she goes to the kitchen_] Well, you've had quite a day, haven't you?  You all right?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's O.K. to not be fine.

speaker: Roz
text: Is it O.K. just to be O.K.?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, sure.  [_She comes back with a tea tray._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Roz. [_notices_] Oh, oh, this milk's expired.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh. [_reads_] Whoa, it has.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's O.K., I can drink the tea straight.  [_She takes the milk toward the kitchen, then stops._]

speaker: Roz
text: I had no idea I let this milk expire.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's really all right, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_breaking down_] I can't take this.  Damn it, how could I let this happen?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Are we still talking about the milk?

speaker: Roz
text: Don't you see?  Milk is a staple!  I let a staple go bad! Good mothers don't let staples go bad!  How can I be responsible for a child when I can't even keep fresh milk in the house?  Kids _need_ milk!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, if it helps, kids don't even drink milk for the first year.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, see?  I didn't even know that!  [_She collapses onto her bed._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't know that either until I was a parent.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't you understand?  I have to know everything.  You can know half of everything.  You can know about the milk, and Lilith can know about the booties and the snugglies--

speaker: Frasier
text: You never met Lilith, did you?  [_He sits her down on her bed, and sits opposite her on the doorstep._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Just forget the milk, and forget the tea.  Talk to me.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't even know where to start.  Everything in my life is about to change.  My body, my love life...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but it's also going to change in fantastic ways.  I remember the first night I brought Frederick home from the hospital.  You put this tiny thing into a tiny little bed, and you look around and you realize that the entire house has changed.

speaker: Roz
text: I know.  I want that.  But, God, the responsibility...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes.  But it's all worth it.  You get to share your life with a remarkable little creature... who only lives in the present, runs around naked without the slightest bit of shame, and can entertain himself for hours just staring at a shiny object.  Isn't that wonderful?

speaker: Roz
text: Isn't that Bulldog?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, technically, yes. [_they laugh_] Roz, I'm going to tell you something I didn't find out until I became a father. You don't just love your children... you fall in love with them.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God... I'm gonna have a baby.  Someone is gonna cry out for "Mom" and it's gonna be me! [_laughs, then cries_] I'm really scared.  What if I can't do this by myself?

speaker: Frasier
text: But, Roz, you're not all by yourself.  I'm here.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thank you, Frasier. [_hugs him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'll be available for you whenever you wish, from taking you out to dinner tonight, to that moment in the delivery room when you say, "Welcome to the world little Jimmy," or "little Sally," or... dare I hope "little Frasier?"

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, I think I'm gonna be sick.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess I got a little carried away there.

speaker: Roz
text: No, I mean I'm gonna hurl!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear God!  [_She runs to the kitchen._]
